Reviews.Title: “low quality but great location”
Reviews.Author: BoroughMark
Reviews.Content: The Pomezia is located very close to the Campo dei Fiori in a very old and interesting part of the city. However the hotel is very old fashioned with only very basic facilities. There is no lift. It can be noisy at night. A plus is free and very fast wifi

Reviews.Title: “Pomezia - dont trust them”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed519
Reviews.Content: I visited the Pomezia hotel in february and when I came to my hotel room at noon it was very cold, estimated 15 degrees. They couldnt fix the heat so on their own initiative they gave me another room. When I was checking out after my visit the man in the reception wanted to charge me 40 euros extra than the room I first booked. When I tried to explain the situation the receptionist was very rude. I got anxious and didnt want to miss the plane home so I was forced to pay him. I even tried to mail them afterwards, but of course they didnt answer. Definitely choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: olga b
Reviews.Content: Good location, room was good size, shower was cramped and no very clean. The owner was not very welcoming however the other staff members were fine. There was not much on offer for breakfast. It was a first for us that everytime you left your room you had to leave your key at reception, Make sure you take anything of value with you and lock your luggage as you should anywhere. There is enough thieves on the streets of Rome to worry about without worrying about your belongings in your room. However would stay hear again for price and location as you are in the heart of Rome . Don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves!”
Reviews.Author: Ladiluck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pomezia for 7 days in June. This was a once and a lifetime trip for me and all was great until our last day in Rome. Upon returning from a day of sightseeing I discovered that my brand new I Pad and my I phone were stolen from our room. It is customary to leave the key with the front desk so I knew it had to be an inside job. At first the front desk guy (family of the owner) was very angry and insistent that this was not the hotel's fault. He made up a ridiculous scenario of a stranger coming in, walking behind the desk, and getting the key for my room. Well, how would they know I had these items? Only the staff would know this. Basically the owner called and promised that the insurance would pay me. I had to sit in an Italian police station for over an hour to obtain a report. For what? It's now been 4 months and even after repeated communication on my part, I have heard nothing from their insurance. So I'm out the I Pad, I phone, and the Otter Box protectors for both. Replacement costs the same as my 7 night stay! Thanks alot to the thieves at Hotel Pomezia in Rome, Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieBarski
Reviews.Content: The location and price are great. Walking distance to all of Rome's biggest attractions. Right next to Campo di Fiori, which is a great square for dinner and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: FrqntTrvllr
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay in Rome (for the money)... Perfectly located, within walking distance to ALL the sites, affordable, clean, friendly... My only 2 quams were that the rooms are tiny (which is a given in Rome anyway), and the check-out was rushed.... Check-out is at 11am, and they had called us a cab to take us to FCO at noon, yet would not let us stay in the room for that extra hour. Neither of these was a big deal in the grand scheme of things. Overall, the good outweighed the bad, and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: comingtoyourcity
Reviews.Content: My hotel reservation at another place got messed up so they put me up here. The location is great just 2 minutes from Campo di Firori. The guy at the reception desk was friendly. My room was $118. I was given a room on the 3rd floor. The stairs are steep and there is no elevator and no air conditioning in the stairwell. My room was a nice size but that's the only good thing I can say about it except that the room was air conditioned. The bed was hard as a rock and I slept very poorly. I heard everything that happened in the hallway. The bathroom was very poorly lit and the little area to put my tolietries on was slanted and everything kept sliding off it. The breakfast was very minimum compared to all the other places I've stayed in Italy. Very little options and most of it wasn't fresh. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fl0rence81
Reviews.Content: Great location, quiet room with three single beds. Good breakfast and the staff was friendly. The bathroom was a bit old but it didn't matter really. I will go again. Definitely fantastic for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Not glamorous, but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: ags9697
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of this hotel - if you want to get away from the tourist traps. It's right off the Piazza Campo De Fiori and it seems to be more in the residences of Rome. But it is well within walking distance of the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, etc etc. The night noise was a little much but I think that's because our room was facing the street, it was a Friday night and the younger crowd was having fun at the bars and restaurants in Campo De Fiori. The breakfast was good and the staff were very helpful. We only stayed at this hotel for one night so I cannot give it the best of reviews but the stay we had was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: DKVM_10
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good. Almost everything can be done by foot. The hotelroom was not very big. about 16 m². In the room we had a rather small bed. a closeth, aircondinothing and a televion. Besides that wass a seperath bathroom and toilet. It wass not that big and luxurious but price technically worth. We paid about 30 euros for a night for 2 persons including breakfast. If you only use your room for sleeping and showering and dont expect much luxerous there is no better hotel than this. They even provide a taxi service to the airport for 40 euro's!

Reviews.Title: “Not acceptable...”
Reviews.Author: MarcCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Very good location. I agree, it is in the heart of Rome. But... some of the staff need to learn a more professional attitude towards clients in the high season. I most highligt the evening/night receptionist, who was very helpfull, but the individuel in the daytime did not in anyway meet our expectations when we had change our plans and stay longer in this hotel than expected. Furthermore the breakfast was to dull and simple. On the positive side, the hotel offers an effective shuttle service to airports with professionals and effective drivers.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Roman life”
Reviews.Author: MonSune
Reviews.Content: Great location! From Pomezia almost every sightseeing hotspot can be reached by walking! It is located in the middle of the historical centre - but not too close, the neighbourhood is quiet !!! -super important - and consists of small streets you can easily get lost in but quickly fall in love with. A few metres from the hotel there is a "forno", a bakery serving excellent pastries just in case somebody wants to wake up late and misses breakfast (the usual plain self service buffet: white bread, sweet pastries, spreads, cornflakes with milk, tea and coffee varieties, juices) The street has a fountain you can refill your water bottle with fresh water. In the street there are many small studios where clothes or accessories are sold. In the direction of Campo di Fiori there are many tavola s where many locals get together, it really isn't a place many tourists get lost. Had a bed in the third floor: the steps are ok for me but I'd request older guests and families to get rooms in the first floors. For the fitter ones: great view from the balcony on the streets and onto the roofs of Rome! WIndows do keep the noise outside! Great bed, comfortable matress, always clean room - is cleant before 11 h - towels are not changed everyday but if you put the dirty towels on the bath room floor they will be exchanged. I loved the access to the main streets and tourist-attractions. For example Via Vittorio Emanuelle II leads to the Vatican if you want to walk straight. There is also a Carrefour supermarket on the Via V Em. II !!! Or Piazza Navona is a 3 minutes walk away, Campo di Fiori is 2 minutes away. The Pantheon isn't far also! There were many occasions I prefered walking than taking tourist buses because of the density of hotspots! But there was a downside, the owner is quite moody and appeared to me as a tense, unfriendly person who couldn't handle guest's requests or complaints. But his brothers and his staff, who helped him out at the cute reception - where everybody gets free maps - were courteous and very very helpful in many ways! They let me use their computer and gave me a bus ticket without hesitating! All in all a wonderful stay in a small but well organised and perfectly located hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location / basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: b12346
Reviews.Content: As the location goes, it does not get much better than this. The hotel is in within 5 minutes of Campo de Fiori, Piazza Farnese, Pantheon and Navona. It is also conveniently located for public transport with a direct tram line to the Trastevere Train Station and bus 40 to the main Termini Train Station (both connection to airport). For the rest, it is just a very simple hotel, though definitely not worse than the standard in Rome for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AJ-NL
Reviews.Content: Pro: great firm bed, splendid location (see all of Rome by foot), just 3 minutes away from Campo de Fiori, helpfull staff, not expensive (we paid €70/night), quiet from any traffic Con: no constant temperature in the shower, rather small rooms, minimal breakfast (yet this is Italy and breakfast in Italian culture is unimportant, great bakery 10 steps from the hotel), and a tile floor in the room Summarizing: this is a great hotel if you're looking for no more than a place to sleep, which should be the case since there is so much to see in Rome, and all is walking distance from the hotel, so go home after sightseeing to refresh or take a nap, and walk again to restaurants both around the hotel or in Trastevere. I would definitly go back!

Reviews.Title: “good place could have been better”
Reviews.Author: dryspuri Posted by a Cleartrip traveler
Reviews.Content: i stayed in reem hotel, location of hotel is very convinient. but they have given me one of basement rooms which i was not happy with room was very small bathroom was also very small tv shows only four channels & no heater in room i felt very cold. reception & cleanliness was very good people are nice & co-0perative. i felt very homely with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: liatgab
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is in the best place in rome - a min walk from campo di fiori and piazza navona. great places to hang out at night and to dine. all the other tourisrt sites is also in a walking distance about the hotel itself - well.. the room is poor,especially the bathroom who was'nt very clean so it was not to pleasen to use. Breakfast is basic, but you have so much great places to eat outside so we didnt look for more. For 2stars hotel its OK.not more.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: nebelloch
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in September 2003 and as it was pretty good I decided to go there again last month together with my family. We had 3 rooms and nothing but troubles: We payed 150 Euros per night, a lot if you consider the following: Our rooms have not been cleaned during our stay. Never. The beds were full of fleas, between the bath tiles was nothing but mould, it was very smelly in all rooms. Used towels (which we had thrown on the floor to get fresh ones) have only been put back on the holders and have not been replaced at first. After I complained to the owner we had fresh ones every day. But the bed sheets haven't been changed for a whole week. We usually had to have breakfast on the table cloth as there were no plates, only coffee cups, saucers and cutlery. The breakfast was poor, hot water, coffee, milk and juice from one and the same machine, the rolls were left over from the day before,.. Well, we had a very good entertainment during breakfast as the owner was complaining about his sisters and other things to the woman behind the bar every single morning in the breakfast room, no matter if there were guests having breakfast. The owner and his men in duty were all pretty rude as they never said hello, thank you etc. They dindn't even say good bye when we left after a week. At night it was also very noisy even though we all had rooms facing the courtyards: The airconditioning of a restaurant next to the hotel was running at high speed and noise all the time. The courtyard was also used as a storage for crates which led to further noise when the staff of the restaurant banged the door or got new bottels from there. Even worse was a cat which spent all day and night in the courtyard, sleeping at day but screaming(!) all night!! Horrible! The owner refused to give us other rooms saying the hotel was fully booked which wasn't true. The airconditioning in one of our rooms wasn't cooling but heating up the rooms. What can I say more?! 6 years ago it used to be a very good, clean and a well-coming hotel, but today it is kind of ruined, dirty, has unfriendly staff and is surely not worth any money.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: VicM
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and I would stay there again. We are a family of 4 and very fussy, but we know what to expect here and are never disapointed. The hotel is very basic, you get a room a bed and a TV, but the location is the best. The price is negotiable to an extent, ask the owner for a discount. The breakfast is ok (just passes) Before you arrive at this hotel, you have to be in the mindset that it is pretty average, this way you wont be disapointed. You are right in the heart of Rome, relatively close to the main sites, say in between the Vatican and the Colosseum. Bus or walking from this location is the best mode of getting around. There are planty of restaurants nearby, I recomend "Monte Carlo" cheap good food good atmosphere, always crowded. Remember, you are in Rome to see Rome, not to spend all your time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good price but.......”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegirl68
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pomezia, on Via Chiavari, Rome, is in a good location near to Piazza Navona. We paid 100 euro per night for our room, I believe it has now gone up to 150 euro. At 100 euro it is quite good value but 150 euro is way too expensive. There are plenty of better options in the 150 euro per night category. Room was clean but we had to change rooms because the air-conditioning was't functioning in our first room. The owner denied it wasn't working but the temperature was set on 26 degrees celcius.....way too hot for Rome in June!!!! Owners spoke very little English and were quite rude. The breakfast is pitiful! Coffee was awful out of the machine and the bread rolls were stale and left over from the day before. If you wanted good coffee you were welcome to purchase it in the breakfast room at the bar for 4 euro. We thought it was a rip-off and in the end got our breakfast elsewhere. I wouldn't stay here again personally.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pomezia”
Reviews.Author: djyoung
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel and the staff are the main reasons to stay at this hotel. It is in a wonderful location within walking distance to the majority of attractions. The staff could not have been more helpful. It was clean and in terms of what I paid it was better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Pomezia and Campo dei Fiori”
Reviews.Author: pdx_traveler065
Reviews.Content: Rome – Although I would have liked to get a room in one of the many convents and monasteries in Rome they did not respond to my emails (in Italian and English). So, we stayed at the Albergo Pomezia (Hotel Pomezia) in room 26 on the second floor (that’s the 3rd floor in the U.S.). This hotel on Via dei Chiavari was near the Campo dei Fiori piazza, but not near enough for noise to get to our room (which faced the back of the hotel and an interior courtyard). At 150 euros per night this was a typical hotel room in price (or maybe on the budget side). We liked the hotel staff and felt safe there. The included continental breakfast was good. The bathroom was modern and clean. We thought the location was perfect for our stay in Rome. We were within easy walking distance to most of the Centro Storico (historical center). We discovered that the #40 express bus came near to our hotel and was a quick ride to the Termini train station. We especially liked the Campo dei Fiori – there were several outdoor restaurants and street musicians but it was never a mob scene (like the Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain or the Spanish Steps). Also there was a farmer’s market there one of the days of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: remus128
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was in a poor condition for the price. The air conditioning didn't work and the hotel managers were rude. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good, little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimz92684
Reviews.Content: This place had a good location for walking anywhere, but I'm glad a taxi dropped us off, cause it was hard to find at first. After the first day, we had it mastered. Breakfast was great, the room was clean and it was nice to look out over the little street, even though the motorcycles were noisy. It didn't really bother us though. Overall, a good little place with helpful hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: italyguy
Reviews.Content: Very close to all the attractions. BUT,,,if you get a room in the front of the building it could be very noisy. See if you can get a room in the back. Makes a differance in the morning. Other than that, the hotel is all that I expected. Not luxurious rooms but adequate for me and my family. It was inexpensive and an evening in Rome didn't finish with a taxi ride back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff member”
Reviews.Author: tropicgirl39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2007. It was a lovely hotel, VERY well situated near the Campo De Fiore. It was close to the major attractions. The room was clean and comfortable. It was Very good value. For us, Arturo the man at the front desk, made this a wonderful place for us. He was SO helpful and forthcoming about everything we needed to know. He greeted all his guests by name and was always cheerful and went out of his way to make sure everyone was comfortable and had everything they needed. His english is also very good. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Dan35
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights. My wife and two kids in the "large" room, my sister and her son in a small room and my mom in another small room. The only positive thing I can say about the hotel is that it's in an excellent location. We were easily able to walk everywhere within 20 minutes. The rooms looked nothing like the pictures on the website. Our "large" room was on the second floor facing the "courtyard" which was a tiny area with about 2 plants. We had a phone, no clock, no television, no internet connection, no working air conditioner. My sister's room on the 2nd floor faced the street (Via Chiavari) which was extremely loud all night long. She was also attacked by fleas and received about 20 flea bites. The following morning, after complaining, the staff denied any possibility that there were fleas in the hotel and refused to partially refund any of the price of that night. They did however move her to a room that had obviously been hastily cleaned because the entire room smelled like a dirty bathroom. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location, horrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: ericboston
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Rome, Italy over Spring Break with College. The hotel was very tacky. THE LOCATION ALTHOUGH WAS THE BEST IN ROME. Breakfast, was just juice and pastries. Nothing much, not very good quality. Next door there is a restraunt/bar place that is better. They offer free outdoor dinning after you buy something from the shop. Hotel is 2 blocks from Campo DEI FIORI, and PIAZZA VENEZIA. The best shopping places in Rome. The best bar rates for drinks in rome. Like 4 euro a beer. But the next is free. The hotel features, 5 floors, no elevators. So getting to the 5th floor is hard especially if you have been walking all day. Do not stay here if your elderly. As a group with my tour, we had to truck our heavy bags through the narrow streets of Rome to get to this hotel. The hotel is not on the main street. It's on a sidestreet. It's ajacent to the SAINT ANDREA DELLA VALLE. nice church, offers good mass times if your one who likes to get up early and go to church before you have your days jouney. The hotel is 50 bucks in euros by TAXI. Unless you take the train runs around 2 euros. I suggest buy a metro pass for 4 euro though you can use mass transit all day! It's good till midnight ROME TIME. The euro is bad right now to the USA dollar, so plan on using the ATM's often to get best rates. The price is high at airport! Service at airport to is horrible in Rome, lots of pickpockets. Hotel is very close to Vatican, about 15-20 min walk. Or 5 min bus ride. I suggest mass transit, because the bus has an express. experience was great in rome, but the hotel could of been better. Suggest if you want more ellegance. Stay closer to the TRAJAN FORUM. Closer to the Victor EMANUELE. MORE SELECTION AND I FOUND CHEEPER LOCAL FOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious, but”
Reviews.Author: treetownie
Reviews.Content: clean and cozy and in a fabulous location, within easy walking distance of most major points of interest. Staff is pleasant and accomodating. Strongly recommend over Smeraldo which is right around the corner, more expensive, and employs surly arrogant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: nemish
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying a couple of nights at the Hotel Pomezia in Rome - the best thing about this hotel has to be the location. It's just around the corner from Campo de Fiori and within easy walking distance of most of the sights. It's a fairly basic hotel, but for the price we paid (140 euros a night) it was perfectly adequate: very clean, everything worked fine (especially the air conditioning, which was vital!) and the reception staff were helpful. Our room was on the third floor and there's no lift, so if you've got problems with stairs, I'd ask for a room on a lower floor. Having said that, being at the top and at the back of the hotel meant it was very quiet. The breakfast room was very pretty & breakfast was the usual continental - rolls, pastries, coffee, juice and cereal. But all very fresh & delicious (the fact that there was a bakery practically next door may have had something to do with that!). We're planning on going back to Rome again at some point, and would definitely stay at the Hotel Pomezia again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kh80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pomezia during the summer of 2005 and really enjoyed it. Nothing fancy, but clean and great AC which was a major bonus during the hot month of July! The location was great and we had no problem walking everywhere from the Colliseum to the Vatican and there were plenty of places to eat and get ice cream right there. The guy (presumably the owner) working there was fantastic, both of them are really nice and went out of their way to make sure we had a good stay. Breakfast was huge and we usually just grabbed something to go, but you definitely had enough to choose from. We made reservations through a travel site and saved a ton, something like 50% off what the normal high season rate was, so look around and if your dates are secure you can really get a good deal on this nice, clean, comfortable hotel with a very friendly staff and a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service”
Reviews.Author: worldlywahoo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Italy and spent three nights at Pomezia. You cannot beat the location. It's on a small cobblestone street with tons of character just a few blocks from Campo d' Fiori, where there are restaurants, bars, gellaterias, etc. This was the big selling point for us. The rooms are not huge, but they are super clean. The bathrooms are large, also. I think it really depends on your luck as to what type of room you will receive. Friends we traveled with got stuck with a pretty bad room. Once they asked for a better one, the management moved them to a larger room with high ceilings, nice decorations, etc. Our room had a small balcony that overlooked a courtyard. Like another poster said, the walls at this hotel are pretty thin, so you can hear other guests as they call down the hall to their pals. But it wasn't too bad. Plus, you can't beat the free cappuccinos in the morning. This is not a four-star hotel, but for 100 Euros a night, it was perfect for us. We stayed at a "nicer" hotel (with TV, free internet access, etc) on our last night in Rome, but the location was just not as good as Pomezia.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Donnavaughan
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of this hotel is its location. Within walking distance of almost everything! Also on 10 minutes to walk to Trastervere which is excellent for eating. Hotel is small, but very clean and breakfast is a bit unimaginative but adequate. The staff are delightful and very helpful. Rooms are small. At the front the windows look onto the very narrow street, and inside they look onto a small deep central square. Probably be very stuffy in summer without much air. But there is air-conditioning. Excellent value for money. I

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully located hotel in the Campo de Fiori area where I could walk to most tourist destinations and shopping. I stayed for 5 nights so they offered me a very decent room with a large bathroom and small balcony. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in a fabulous area at a decent price. The bathroom was very clean and the staff very helpful and attentive, offering to help make phone calls etc. They also made some very good restaurant recommendations! Thanks for everything Pomezia! I had a wonderful time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: jeffp94114
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights as part of a 3-week trip in Italy. I knew this area was where we wanted to be and the choices are limited, but we were very happy to get a place here for 125 euros/night, as it's such a perfect location in Rome. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, and the hotel is on a relatively quiet street close to some of the best sights and down-to-earth eating places. Rooms have new bathrooms, lots of hot water, and A/C is available (extra; we didn't need it). There's no TV. The only drawback is the noise from other guests - walls and doors are thin, the hallways are inexplicably tiled rather than carpeted, so you hear all comings and goings. To make matters worse, the hotel suffers from affordability :-) so you get school groups of screaming teenagers etc. In the end it feels more like a hostel with separate bedrooms than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location”
Reviews.Author: redmatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in early oct.Fantastic location, could not have been beaten.Walking distance to all main attractions and in an area surrounded by great value restaurants and bars. Rooms basic, but very clean.Staff very friendly, especially Arturo, whose English is amazing, as were several other languages!We would and almost certainly will return to Hotel Pomezia as there is too much to see and do in such a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Wyn8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pomezia in September for 4 nights. The staff were very friendly with excellent English, they gave us lots of information on tours, sights etc. We had a room on the third floor, modern, clean, with air conditioning and a view over the street. There was no TV or fridge. Bathroom was clean. Biggest negative was no lift - climbing 60 steep steps with luggage and after hot days touring was not fun! I would definitely stay again, can't beat the location, we walked everywhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Pomezia
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Chiavari, 12, 00186 Rome, Italy
